physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Erythroderma, protracted diarrhea, pulmonary abscesses caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa. T-cell counts very low, B-cell counts normal, eosinophilia (1000 cells per cubic millimeter), elevated serum immunoglobulin levels, IgM heterogeneity restricted, and IgG autoantibodies against erythrocytes and neutrophils detected. No antibodies after immunization with tetanus toxoid, diphtheria toxoid, and poliovirus.
T-cell counts low; specific percentages provided in Table 1 showing various immunologic parameters.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: T-cell counts gradually increased by 2 years but remained below normal values.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Continued observations of T-cell counts and immune parameters from Table 1, indicating changes after treatment.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement observed after transplant, as indicated by correction of the immunodeficiency.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient is well and living at home.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant improvement in condition and immune function noted post-treatment.
